meanings.sent1: The old map was creased and hard to read.
meanings.sent2: Her creased shirt showed she had been working hard.
meanings.sent3: The creased paper airplane flew crookedly across the room.
meanings.sent4: His creased face told the story of a life well-lived.
meanings.sent5: The creased leaves rustled in the gentle breeze.

meanings.definition: To make lines or wrinkles in something
meanings.sent1: She creased the paper before folding it into a crane.
meanings.sent2: The tailor carefully creased the fabric before sewing.
meanings.sent3: He accidentally creased the important document while rushing.
meanings.sent4: The mountain range creased the horizon in the distance.
meanings.sent5: The chef creased the dough to create a perfect pie crust.
